Issues.Title: Support @Input() default values
Issues.Body:
# Feature Request

### Relevant Package
Main component API, Input on Angular/Core


### Description
It would be very helpful to support @Input() default values. There are very complicated and unnatural workarounds for this but it would be a lot better if this is just a simple native feature.


### Describe the solution you'd like
@Input() myValue: string = 'abcd'
If there's an input value this value gets an override, else the component works with the default value.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
There are complex implementations for this using NgOnChanges. For someone who is constantly working on design systems, this is very innefficient
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support @Input() default values" (#42048)

Issues.Title: Support event forwarding
Issues.Body:
# Feature Request

### Relevant Package
Angular/Core component API


### Description
Please add support to event forwarding (similar to Svelte). This feature reduces dramatically overcomplicated workarounds and endless @Output() configuration when working with nested components. Sometimes you just want to be able to easily pass forward the event to the parent. This would add much-needed simplicity to this aspect of the framework.
 
### Describe the solution you'd like
Just an idea: 
<app-my-component (myClick)></app-my-component> // This forwards the 'click' event to the parent component.
<app-parent-component (myClick)="eventHandler($event)"></app-parent-component> // the parent component works with the forwarded event and its respective data.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Would it be also very useful to be able to forward native events like 'click', 'change', 'input'.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support event forwarding" (#42049)

Issues.Title: View updates correctly if parent sends Input to child OnInit and child emits Output. Parent view does not update correctly if child passes those values to another child and back. Expression Changed.
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report ### Description I'm see the view update correctly in a parent component when it passes data back and forth using a single child component. However, I'm getting ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError if the parent component passes data to a component which passes the data to another component before passing it back through to the parent. **This works:** 1. A root component sets loading OnInit 2. The root component uses OnInit to send a value to a child component after a delay (simulated api call) 2. OnChanges in the child, it uses an Output to emit a value back to the parent 3. The parent updates the the value of loading based on the output 4. The view in the parent is updated correctly **This does not** 1. A root component sets loading OnInit 2. The root component uses OnInit to send a value to a passthrough component after a delay (simulated api call) 3. The passthrough sends the value to the child component via an Input 4. OnChanges in the child, it uses an Output to emit a value back to the passthrough 5. The passthrough uses an Output to emit the value back to the parent 6. The parent updates the the value of loading based on the output 7. The view in the parent is not updated correct and ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError occurs Why doesn't the output event emitter in the 2nd case cause the parent view to be checked? This type of behavior would be useful to be because I want to have detachable form pieces that are fed data from a parent via Inputs and can notify the parent of a change so the parent can act on that change. It would be great if those form pieces would work a few levels removed from the parent instead of just one. ## Minimal Reproduction **Basic issue:** https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-11-expression-changed?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts **Example with forms:** https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-11-split-form You can see the Expression Changed error go away and the view update correctly if you comment out the passthrough and uncomment the child in app.component.html ## Exception or Error 

preview-2bfbc3e0fe63b64e42deb.js:1 ERROR Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'ngIf: false'. Current value: 'ngIf: true'.
    at viewDebugError (errors.ts:38)
    at expressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError (errors.ts:24)
    at checkBindingNoChanges (util.ts:103)
    at checkNoChangesNodeInline (view.ts:486)
    at checkNoChangesNode (view.ts:474)
    at debugCheckNoChangesNode (services.ts:471)
    at debugCheckDirectivesFn (services.ts:398)
    at Object.eval [as updateDirectives] (AppComponent.html:16)
    at Object.debugUpdateDirectives [as updateDirectives] (services.ts:390)
    at checkNoChangesView (view.ts:354)
## Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

11.2.13
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "View updates correctly if parent sends Input to child OnInit and child emits Output. Parent view does not update correctly if child passes those values to another child and back. Expression Changed." (#42047)

Issues.Title: Directive on ng-container: inconsistent behavior when accessing 'el.nativeElement.nodeValue'
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report ### Description I'm trying to determine whether a (attribute-)directive was applied to a ng-container element. I let angular inject the directives ElementRef and access 'nativeElement.nodeValue' for this. When running a development build (e.g. with ng serve) this returns 'ng-container' as expected. On a production build, an empty string is returned. **Directive:** ``` @Directive({ selector: '[my-directive]' }) export class MyDirectiveDirective { constructor(private el: ElementRef) { const nodeValue = this.el.nativeElement.nodeValue; console.log(nodeValue); } } ``` **Usage:** ``` ``` ## Minimal Reproduction Repo: https://github.com/koglerch13/angular-ngcontainer-nodevalue 1. Start the application with 'ng serve' 2. open the DevTools/Console 3. Observe the output (should appear similar the following screenshot) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15924552/117821256-ae460000-b26b-11eb-8733-8c332ed1b4ea.png) 4. Stop the dev server 5. Re-run the application with 'ng serve --prod' 6. Observe the console output again (see the following screenshot) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15924552/117821548-fe24c700-b26b-11eb-82f6-4900f3eeeba9.png) **Expected result:** both outputs are the same **Actual result:** Outputs differ (see screenshots) ## Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.2.12
Node: 14.16.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.2.13
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.12
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.12
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.12
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.12
@angular/cli                    11.2.12
@schematics/angular             11.2.12
@schematics/update              0.1102.12
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.1.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Directive on ng-container: inconsistent behavior when accessing 'el.nativeElement.nodeValue'" (#42045)

Issues.Body:
The test example here does not work: https://angular.io/guide/testing-attribute-directives You'll get an error like:

Because [ElementRef](https://angular.io/api/core/ElementRef) does not resolved / work. I can't find a solution or explanation.

Issues.Title: build(docs-infra): show a dist-tag when installing the CLI on non-stable versions (BACKPORT: 9.1.x)
Issues.Body:
It is important to use the correct major version of the Angular CLI when
following the examples in the tutorials. This commit provides a custom
element that renders an appropriate dist-tag in the setup step of
the tutorial when the docs are not in "stable" mode.

Fixes #39821
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build(docs-infra): show a dist-tag when installing the CLI on non-stable versions (BACKPORT: 9.1.x)" (#42042)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): unclear lexer error when using private identifier in expressions
Issues.Body:
TypeScript supports ECMAScript private identifiers. It can happen that
developers intend to access such members from within an expression.

This currently results in an unclear error from the lexer. e.g.

```
'Parser Error: Unexpected token # at column 1 in [{{#myField}}] in C:/test.ts@5:2
```

We could improve such errors by tokenizing private identifiers similar to
how the TypeScript scanner processes them. Later we can report better
errors in the expression parser or in the typecheck block. This commit
causes all private identifier tokens to be disallowed, so it never
reaches the type checker. This is done intentionally as private
identifiers should not be considered valid Angular syntax, especially
because private fields are not guaranteed to be accessible from within
a component/directive definition (e.g. there cases where a template
function is generated outside of the class; which results in private
members not being accessible; and this results in mixed/confusing
behavior).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): unclear lexer error when using private identifier in expressions" (#42027)

Please describe: ## What is the current behavior? https://angular.io/guide/lazy-loading-ngmodules#resolvers CLI command does not show correctly in docs Issue Number: N/A ## What is the new behavior? Correct syntax highlighting ## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? - [ ] Yes - [x] No ## Other information

Issues.Title: docs: change `updating-to-version-*` redirects to point to the respective versions
Issues.Body:
Previously, the `updating-to-version-*` URLs would redirect to the next version update guide. More specifically:
- `/guide/updating-to-version-10` --> `https://v11.angular.io/guide/updating-to-version-11`
- `/guide/updating-to-version-11` --> `/guide/updating-to-version-12`

This seems confusing and inconsistent. Either all URLs should redirect to the latest update guide (currently `/guide/updating-to-version-12`) or each URL should redirect to the corresponding version.

This commit implements the second approach:
- `/guide/updating-to-version-10` --> `https://v10.angular.io/guide/updating-to-version-10`
- `/guide/updating-to-version-11` --> `https://v11.angular.io/guide/updating-to-version-11`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: change `updating-to-version-*` redirects to point to the respective versions" (#42019)

### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
In order to keep high quality in the software we are developing, we run unit tests when we are about to push changes to a pull request or merge request. Waiting for 1k tests to run might be a waste of time.

I am looking out for something similar to what jest does with react, it allows devs to run tests related to just modified files. The flags I'm looking for are: **--onlyChanged**, **--findRelatedTests**, and **--changedSince**

I've been thinking in using git and bash to realize what the tests should the cli run, all those that are directly or indirectly related to the modified files

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): execute dart-sass in a worker
Issues.Body:
The dart-sass Sass implementation will now be executed in a separate worker thread. The wrapper worker implementation provides an interface that can be directly used by Webpack's `sass-loader`.
The worker implementation allows dart-sass to be executed in its synchronous mode which can be up to two times faster than its asynchronous mode. The worker thread also allows Webpack to continue other bundling tasks while the Sass stylesheets are being processed.
Initial testing indicated a ~14% build time improvement for AIO.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): execute dart-sass in a worker" (#20740)

Issues.Title: Support for Webpack5 ?
Issues.Body:
Dear Angular Team Members,

Need your suggestion on below requirement:

We have identified one of a feature "Module Federation Plugin" which is part of WebPack 5 will solve our problems. Though there is an opt-in option to use Webpack 5,we are little skeptical to use since Angular is not yet supported. Is there any reason why it is not supported? It would be helpful for us if you provide any information regarding this matter.

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support for Webpack5 ?" (#20739)

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When using the latest version of `@angular/cli` and `npm` the command `ng new` fails during dependencies installation.
_(but it's working fine with `yarn`)_

> `karma-jasmine-html-reporter@1.6.0` requires a peer `jasmine-core@">=3.7.1"` but `jasmine-core@3.6.0` is used in the root project.

Run the following command:

```sh
ng new app-test --package-manager=npm --defaults
```

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): disallow additional properties in builders sections
Issues.Body: With this change we disallow add additional properties to the `target` object.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): disallow additional properties in builders sections" (#20729)

Issues.Title: Unset config
Issues.Body:
**fix(@angular/cli): allow config object to be of JSON.**

With this change we allow unset a config value to be a JSON.
    
Example, `ng config -g schematics {}` will remove the entire `schematics` section from the configuration.


**fix(@angular/cli): allow unsetting config when value is `undefined`**
    
With this change we allow unset a config value when the provided value is `undefined`.
    
Example, `ng config -g schematics undefined` will remove the entire `schematics` section from the configuration.


Closes #20718

Issues.Title: Override port when running "ng test"
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [x] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

It is currently impossible to easily specify a port when running `ng test`.
Even with the current ability of `ng test` to automatically increment the port number when a port is already in use when you run multiple test process in Docker containers, there is no way to forward the port of the container and have it be consistent with the port shown in the console when starting the process.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Make it possible to override the port being used by `ng test` with a parameter similar to `--port 9877`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Another way to address this would be to add the ability to edit the text shown when the command starts. However, this is far from ideal.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Override port when running "ng test"" (#20715)

Allows project's created with npm 7+ to successfully install. `karma-jasmine-html-reporter@1.6` requires dependency versions not present in a new 11.2.x project.

Fixes #20719

### [`v4.0.0`](https://togithub.com/bholloway/resolve-url-loader/releases/4.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bholloway/resolve-url-loader/compare/3.1.3...4.0.0)

**Features**

-   Better resolution of the original source location - You can more successfully use `url()` in variables and mixins.
-   Dependencies now accept a wider range and explicit dependency on `rework` and `rework-visit` has been removed.

**Breaking Changes**

-   The `engine` option is deprecated which means the old `rework` engine is deprecated.
-   The `keepQuery` behaviour is now the default, the `keepQuery` option has been removed.
-   The `removeCR` option defaults to `true` when executing on Windows OS.
-   The `absolute` option has been removed.
-   The `join` option has changed.

Issues.Title: Expose Webpack Configuration
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üöÄ Feature request

### Description

In order to integrate Angular with some external tooling like [Cypress Component Testing](https://docs.cypress.io/guides/component-testing/introduction), it is necessary to provide a webpack (or any other building tool) configuration. 
While `AngularCompilerPlugin` is a really good start, it doesn't cover the whole magic happening under the hood of `@angular-devkit/build-angular`. This needs us to create a custom webpack config using the `AngularCompilerPlugin`.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Even though Webpack is kind of an Angular implementation detail, it would be a dream come true to expose a function like `…µresolveWebpackConfig({target: 'my-app'})` that could be inspired from:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/f6135a20d1f3fd8afe85ba10906afb1fb7e91dea/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index.ts#L99-L104

I understand that this would considerably extend the public API's surface and that is why I am totally alright if we could start some experiments with a non-public function (hence the `…µ`).
https://github.com/jscutlery/test-utils/blob/ec422695e9de3ecfa560143098bda6198756e860/packages/cypress-mount-integration/src/plugins/index.js#L6-L40

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Creating a public library exposing a webpack config that mimics `@angular-devkit/build-angular` behavior.

If you are OK with the idea, I'd be happy to help.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Expose Webpack Configuration" (#20731)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/schematics): detect package manager
Issues.Body:
The Angular Devkit Schematics defaults to NPM when no package manager option is passed into the Package Manager Executor.

I think that we can improve on this by attempting to detect the package manager by the presence of lock files. 

Please let me know what you think and how it can be improved.

Issues.Title: ng build ignores locale.baseHref
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Looks so ### Description With this config: ```json "i18n": { "sourceLocale": { "code": "en-US", "baseHref": "" }, "locales": { "de": { "baseHref": "", "translation": "projects/project_name/src/i18n/messages.de.xlf" } } }, "architect": { "build": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser", "configurations": { "production": { "localize": ["de"], ``` `ng build` ignores "baseHref" of the locale and always adds "de". If configurations.production.localize set to "true", then it will add "de" for some files an "en-US" for others. Would be awesome if empty baseHref had effect, described here: https://stackoverflow.com/a/61384524/680786 (not adding any prefix) ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: webpack-dev-server creates unnecessary file watchers
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description The webpack-dev-server sets up a lot of unnecessary watchers that have no impact on the emitted code. I'm not sure if this should be an improvement in webpack or more configuration in Angular CLI. The number of unnecessary watchers can be greatly reduced by configuring `devServer.watcherOptions.ignore`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction > ng new project Add logging to `createFsWatchInstance` in chokidar: ``` function createFsWatchInstance(path, options, listener, errHandler, emitRaw) { // ... try { console.log(path); return fs.watch(path, options, handleEvent); } // ... } ``` > ng s ## üî• Exception or Error Chokidar, through webpack, sets up lots of unnecessary watchers on things like: * Unused code * LICENSE-files * Markdown * /dist * /.git * etc In large projects, this will cause chokidar to throw an exception: > System limit for number of file watchers reached. ## üåç Your Environment

When the line-height is much larger than the diameter, the spinner breaks. 

Example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rgtfre-k7iryu?file=src/app/progress-spinner-overview-example.html

This explicitly sets it to 0 rather than whatever it would inherit.

Issues.Title: feat(COMPONENT): Improve CdkTable keyboard accessibility when combined with MatSort
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
A way to easily access MatSort within the template when used in conjunction with cdk-header-cell 

#### Use Case
Improve the implementation of CdkTable navigation for users.

### Additional Detail
When using MatSort, an accessible sort header can be conveniently added to CdkTable. However, when implementing arrowkey accessibility per [W3's datatable example](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/grid/dataGrids.html#),  it is hard to listen to keydown events from the sort header within the table template. It would be nice to have an easier way to control keydown events on the sort headers.

Also, this is my first feature request, so sorry in advance if I did something wrong!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(COMPONENT): Improve CdkTable keyboard accessibility when combined with MatSort" (#22667)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): pass correct inject flags to injector
Issues.Body:
We have a call to `Injector.get` in the date range input which is supposed to fall back to `null` if the value doesn't resolve, however we're missing the `Optional` flag. It works by accident at the moment, because the inject flags aren't actually being passed through by the framework.

https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/41592 is supposed to fix the framework issue, but their CI will break due to our usage.

These changes fix our usage in order to unblock the framework PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): pass correct inject flags to injector" (#22665)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-datepicker): Datepicker input doesn't clear on invalid value
Issues.Body:
When I enter invalid text in the date input, the control value goes null but the datepicker input is not cleared of the invalid value.

#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
- Components: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-z7nui6?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdatepicker-overview-example.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the above stackblitz link
2. In the date field, input an invalid value like "31-31-2001" and tab out
3. The formcontrol goes to an invalid state, the value becomes null but the input still shows the invalid value
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

On entering an invalid value, the input should be cleared as the control value is null.


#### Actual Behavior

The control value is null, but the invalid value is still shown on the screen


#### Environment

- Angular: 11.2.13
- CDK/Material: 11.2.12
- Browser(s): Edge, Chrome, Firefox
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-datepicker): Datepicker input doesn't clear on invalid value" (#22663)

Issues.Title: No Main Landmark when Mat Dialog is Open
Issues.Body:
When running accessibility assessments I consistently face the "Document must have one main landmark" violation when a mat-dialog is open (despite there being a main landmark in the main shell of our app's markup). When dialogs are closed, there is no issue with this specific violation. Simply adding a role="main" to a dialog's markup does not solve the problem. This actually causes the accessibility engine to detect both main landmarks and thus reports "Can not have more than one main landmark". 

I suspect this could be a symptom of the way in which the CDK overlay container is "appended" to the bottom of the html document, rather than being nested inside the main landmark element. It's also possible there is a work around or even best practice for circumventing this that I have not found. Either way, there seems to be little mention of this anywhere.

*Note* - I get the same results when testing with both axeDevTools and WAVE

![MainLandmark](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55161966/117691630-1fad8200-b18a-11eb-98de-8dcb358099bb.PNG)
![Markup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55161966/117691632-20461880-b18a-11eb-8155-40b13020a24c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No Main Landmark when Mat Dialog is Open" (#22656)

Issues.Title: help(DRAG AND DROP): Change standard DropList behavior after drop an item
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

I have dropList working as big scale dropzone. For this master list children, I'm tracking where they're being dropped and applying their *transformation(position)* values to *fix* their position on the dropzone.

I want to rely on the useful behavior of droplists, but although the elements retain their x/y translate positions, as soon as I move a second element inside the master list. The standard list behavior kick in and clear my transformation values e align all the elements within a list format.

*I just want to know if there is a way to stop the cdkDropList process of list alignment and force a "free" drag drop behavior for its children?*
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "help(DRAG AND DROP): Change standard DropList behavior after drop an item" (#22655)

Issues.Title: bug(button): Opening sidenav with toolbar button leaves unwanted halo on button
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue:

#### Expected Behavior

The menu button should be without darker blue halo.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
A darker blue color surrounds the menu button

- Angular: See stackblitz
- CDK/Material: See stackblitz
- Browser(s): Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): MacOs

Issues.Title: feat(ScrollDispatcher): Register native elements to ScrollDispatcher service
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

As a developer you should have a chance to register native html elements to ScrollDispatcher service. Currently you can only add it by adding the angular directive which isn't allowed to be done dynamically.

#### Use Case

We are using [AG-Grid](https://www.ag-grid.com/) and there we have implemented custom cells which include Mat-Autocomplete. The problem is that the grid has a nested box which is scrollable (not the outer container) and soI can't add the 'cdkScrollable' directive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(ScrollDispatcher): Register native elements to ScrollDispatcher service" (#22652)

Issues.Title: bug(DatePicker): Cannot get custom date format input to work with moment
Issues.Body:
The date picker doesn't allow for date entry if you use moment and select a custom date input format (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD).

As soon as you type say 2 moment will create a full date from that.

Also if you try and say edit the year by replacing 2 characters it shifts the year by adding 00's in front. So changing 2021 to 2019 would as you type have 0020.

I tried to create a stackblitz from my code but gave up as it was having issues dealing with the legacy moment library.

Ideally I'd like to wrap everything in a custom component using ControlValueAccessor that I've been able to do with everything else.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(DatePicker): Cannot get custom date format input to work with moment" (#22644)

Issues.Title: build(deps): bump handlebars from 4.7.2 to 4.7.7
Issues.Body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.7.2 to 4.7.7.
Changelog

Sourced from handlebars's changelog.

v4.7.7 - February 15th, 2021

  • fix weird error in integration tests - eb860c0
  • fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736) - b6d3de7
  • fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736) - f058970
  • refactor: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683) - 77825f8
  • chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13 - 3789a30

(POSSIBLY) BREAKING CHANGES:

  • the changes from version 4.6.0 now also apply in when using the compile-option "strict: true". Access to prototype properties is forbidden completely by default, specific properties or methods can be allowed via runtime-options. See #1633 for details. If you are using Handlebars as documented, you should not be accessing prototype properties from your template anyway, so the changes should not be a problem for you. Only the use of undocumented features can break your build.

That is why we only bump the patch version despite mentioning breaking changes.

Compatibility notes:

Compatibility notes:
